titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mi Gente Records, 2013-2017 UA.31.04.0017
titlestmt.author: Tracy M. Jackson

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-06-30 09:07:55 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Mi Gente is the Latino Student Association at Duke University and the largest Latino student group on campus. The group has the goals of serving the Latino population at Duke and bringing Latino culture to the larger Duke population. The Mi Gente records include the group's meeting minutes from 2013-2014; captures of the website from 2010-2015; captures of the group's Twitter feed from 2015; agendas, promotional materials, and strategy documents from 2014-2017; and digital photographs from 2015-2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mi Gente is the Latino Student Association at Duke University and the largest Latino student group on campus. Founded in 1992, Mi Gente's mission is to "provide a sense of community among Latin@s at Duke as well as to promote awareness and sponsor activities about Latin@ cultural, political, educational, and social issues," as stated on the group's homepage (http://sites.duke.edu/dukemigente/about/who-are-we/, accessed January 19, 2016).

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Electronic records in this collection have been migrated to a library server and digital use copies can only be accessed onsite in the Rubenstein Library Reading Room.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Mi Gente Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2015 and 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mi Gente Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Tracy M. Jackson, January, 2016 and Matthew Farrell, September 2017.
Accessions described in this collection guide: UA2015-0040 and UA2017-0049.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes minutes from Council Meetings September 2013 - March 2014, agendas, promotional materials, and strategy documents from 2014-2017, digital photographs from 2015-2016, as well as captures of the group's two websites from 2010-2015 and Twitter feed from 2015.

controlaccess.subject: Hispanic American college students -- North Carolina -- Durham

dao.xlink:title: Mi Gente Latin Student Association Twitter feed

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyers and other promotional materials from events and activities hosted by Mi Gente.

did.physdesc: 703 digital files (photographic and document formats); approximately 4.5 gigabytes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of events and trips taken by Mi Gente members. Records include meeting agenda and an endorsement for a candidate running for Young Trustee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mi Gente constitution and text of speech delivered at the First Latinx Awards Night.

did.physdesc: 11 digital files (document and video formats); approximately 0.1 gigabytes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Records related to demands made of and negotiations with University Administration. Also includes an open letter to the Duke Community and a letter of solidarity with the activists participating in the 2016 Allen Building Takeover.
